body.p:
Hon. James. F. Robinson
My dear Sir

I write you at the earnest solicitation of my My Bro-Inlaw Dr. Samuel Maguire of Fleming County, who is Capt of some 65 home guards -- who are the most Loyal men of the State, and who are entirely without arms. They have in two instances been called upon to meet a rebel force passing through their County & the County of Bath to join -- Humphrey Marshall -- many of them shouldered what squirrel rifles they could borrow from their neighbours with a warning of only a few hours -- many of them travelling on foot a distance of 40 miles in order to disperse the enemy, many of them applied to me in
person a few days since and desire if possible to have arms placed in their hands, so they can fight the battles of their Government & State,

I know many of them personally, & know that a truer or braver people does not inhabit this beautiful world of ours. Can you send them 50 stand of arms at once -- they are in my opinion entitled to them & should receive them.

My Brother Inlaw Dr. Maguire will be responsible for theme safe return of the arms sent. They are wanted for a section of Country lying in the direction of Morgan, Carter & Lawrence Counties where many rebels pass to join the Southern Confederacy -- excuse me for thus troubling you -- but my apology must be the exigency of
the case.
Congratulating you & our State upon the position you have been called upon to occupy

I am my dear sir
Your attached friend
Wm. R. Fleming

P S.
The boxes containing the guns mark.
Dr. Samuel Maguire
Poplar. Plains
Fleming County
Ky

Will. R Fleming
Lex
arms 50 asked for home guard in Fleming
